indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: -Piloting of innovative system of providing special social services to the elderly at home, development of a network of day centres for elderly, centres for social adaptation for the homeless -More than 22,000 oralmans in the territory of EKO receive adaptation services in the Centre for Adaptation and Social Integration in Semei city -Over 500 micro and macro enterprises (with more than 3000 people) benefit from the development of entrepreneurial skill and knowledge on climate change adaptation in 17 districts of EKO

baseline.comment: Vulnerable groups, especially women, children, migrants, refugees, young and aged people, people with disabilities need improved access to markets, goods, services and social safety nets.

target.comment: 1. Improving access to social and economic services through training of social workers of Public Health System, the employees of cultural centers and internal affairs bodies on basics of sign language. 2. Training of persons with impaired visual function on classical wellness massage. 3. Support of vocational - technical education for repatriates. 4. Business services at the rayon level, provided by online centers with participation of Focal points. 5. Business Support Grant Program.

actual.comment: with the financial support of UNDP the following trainings were organized: 15 social workers of the health system (training medical, psychological, educational, legal, household skills and skills of occupational therapy) and 15 public officials (PSC, museums, specialized libraries) have learned sign language to improve the efficiency of service of the population with limited hearing; 2. 15 persons with severe visual functions learned classical wellness massage, including those with the first group of disability. 3. Repatriates continue to be one of the most vulnerable groups in the region. In order to improve their professionalism and competitiveness, the UNDP organized short-term vocational training courses. Fields of study were identified based on the results of the specially conducted survey in 2013. 4. In 2014 on the basis of online centers 95,842 people have been trained and consulted, including 66,535 rural entrepreneurs, unemployed people, civil servants and PWD. 5.In order to support the business in June 2014 the second phase of the grant programme was held to support "Green Business" SMEs implemented by PF "Development of Youth Entrepreneurship" (hereinafter - "OFRMP"). The second meeting of the Grant Committee was held in November. A budget of $ 33,000 enabled to launch 8 selected business projects, three of which have been co-financed under the state program "Roadmap employment 2020", and the remaining 5 were financed in the framework of the Joint Programme and with the contribution of PF "Development of Youth Entrepreneurship".

target.comment: 1. Grant program for inclusive projects (creation of a "barrier-free environment", employment promotion, social support facilities, capacity building of NGOs and individuals working in the social sphere). 2. Courses for repatriates (computer literacy and language. 3. Business Support Grant Program. 4. Monitoring of projects.

iati-activity.description: The overall objective of the Project is to contribute to the long-term environmental sustainability and inclusive economic development of Kazakhstan

iati-activity.title: Supporting Kazakhstans Transi
iati-activity.description: Supporting Kazakhstans Transition to a Green Economy model

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Contribute to the long-term environmental sustainability and inclusive economic development of Kazakhstan through supporting the country's transition to a Green Economy model.

baseline.comment: In the follow-up to the Rio+20 process on sustainable development, Kazakhstan took a landmark decision to transition towards a sustainable Green Economy Concept, aimed at implementing a completely new development paradigm with particular focus on the water sector.

target.comment: IInception report development and endorsement, view of economic instruments and MPWI bussnes models, demonstration projects in key sectors , form a pool of pilot projects. Multi stakeholder dialogue on pilot projects, pilot projects concepts developing

actual.comment: During 2015 Inception workshop was conductead and inceptionreport was developed adn approved by donor, NGOs Grant programme was launched, grants Agreements are signed, 3 pilot concepts were developed and approved by key stakeholders, workshop was organized for the reccomendations collection form key stakeholders and detailed work plans on pilot projects implementation developed,review of economic instruments and MPWI bussnes models started

iati-activity.title: Supporting sustainable land management
iati-activity.description: Supporting sustainable land management

iati-activity.title: Supporting sustainable land ma
iati-activity.description: Supporting sustainable land management

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Pastures and crop land capacity assessed and incorporated as active components in Integrated Land Use Plans, Improved 20 000 of abandoned lands through introduction of at least three new advanced practices on pasture logging/watering Decrease grazing rate of moderately degraded pastures by 40%; 2. At least two policy and legal documents regulating system of agricultural subsidies in Kazakhstan 3. promotes small-scale holders leading to soil and vegetation quality improvements. 4. Pastures and crop land capacities assessed and incorporated as active components in Integrated Land Use Plans, 5. At least two state programs reorient funding from traditional to green agriculture.

baseline.comment: 1. Land use planning does not account for ecosystem values, leading to ecosystem degradation 2. Absence of advanced practices on pasture logging/watering; 3. Inadequate policy and legal framework to support a transformation to SLM 4. Traditional subsidies in agriculture prioritize productivity and take no heed of ecosystem carrying capacity 5. Limited and inefficient investments in pasture and maintenance of productive landscapes

target.comment: 1. Inception workshop 2. The national project team are in place 3. Assessment of national regulatory document on agricultural system of subsidy 4. Development of methodology for conducting inventory of pastures and crop land capacities in five target regions 5. Prioritization of implementation activities per each target regions

actual.comment: 1. Conducted one inception workshop 2. Project personnel are on board (Project manager, Project admin assistant) 3. Produced conducted report on agricultural subsidies in Kazakhstan 4. Produced methodology for pasture land inventory analyses based on the East Kazakhstan regions as one of the pilot project areas. 5. Identified five priority topics per ach target zones on demonstration plots. (fruit and vegetable growing for Almaty region, Wheat, crop diversification and precise agriculture for Akmola regions, Pastoral livestock breeding for East Kazakhstan regions, Crop husbandry and diversification, Pasture and precise agriculture for Kostanay region, Soil desalinization, crop diversification and organic farming for Kyzylorda region and Wheat, crop diversification and precise agriculture for North Kazakhstan regions.
